title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5900.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5900.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part: (a) The term foundation means the New York

State Science and Technology Foundation. (b) The term record means any information
kept, held, filed, produced or reproduced by or for the foundation. (c) The term records access officer means the
manager of finance and administration of the foundation. (d) The term workday means the hours between
9 a.m. and 5 p.m. any day except Saturday, Sunday, a public holiday or a day on
which the foundation is otherwise closed for general business. (e) The term trade secret means a secret
formula, method, process, device, pattern, or compilation of information that
gives one an opportunity to gain an advantage over competitors or potential
competitors. (f) The term
proprietary information means any exclusive or secret knowledge or information
held by a person or enterprise, which, if disclosed, would cause substantial
injury to the competitive position of the person or
enterprise. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

5900.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
